intro: Anthriscus heterosantha, commonly known as cow parsley, is a biennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the carrot family (Apiaceae) and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its seeds are small and dry, often dispersed by wind, while its foliage is often used in herbal medicine. The plant is also a food source for various insects and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
